snippet: Mark Lyttleton, who left BlackRock, the world’s largest investment firm, in 2013, was accused by British authorities of trading two stocks using inside information....
lead_paragraph: Mark Lyttleton, who left BlackRock, the world’s largest investment firm, in 2013, was accused by British authorities of trading two stocks using inside information.

headline.main: Former BlackRock Fund Manager Pleads Guilty to Insider Trading
headline.print_headline: Ex-BlackRock Trader Enters a Plea of Guilty
